question: Two angles form a linear pair. If one angle is 110°, find the measure of the other angle.

steps.description: Recall the property of a linear pair: the sum of angles is 180°.

steps: Angles on a straight line are supplementary
Supplementary means they add up to 180°

common_mistakes: Subtracting from 90° (confusing linear pair with complementary angles)

topic: The Triangle and its Properties (Exterior Angle)
question: An exterior angle of a triangle is of measure 105° and one of its interior opposite angles is of measure 45°. Find the measure of the other interior opposite angle.

steps.description: Identify the relevant property: Exterior Angle Property of a Triangle.
State the formula: Exterior Angle = Sum of two interior opposite angles.

steps: Find the interior adjacent angle using linear pair: 180° - 105° = 75°
Use Angle Sum Property for the triangle: 180° - (75° + 45°)

common_mistakes: Adding 105 and 45 (forgetting that 105 is the sum, not an addend)
Subtracting from 180 immediately (confusing with supplementary angles)
Assuming the triangle is isosceles or equilateral without evidence
